title: I made buttons out of plastic straws : r/ZeroWaste - Reddit
body: Plastic, when heated, releases some pretty toxic, noxious chemicals that build up in your body over time and can cause cancer and other illnesses. I'm sure after this brief exposure you're not that bad off, but it's not a good idea to make a habit of this kind of thing. ... You just have to go out and buy some straws. - SassyMillie: This is a cool idea but I doubt I would go to this much effort for a few buttons. (Not to discount OP, whatsoever - to each his/her own.) I'm more about recycling my buttons from old clothes. I always cut them off and keep them in a nice vintage ball jar. I have quite a collection and if I need one or more that doesn't have a match I'll often replace all the buttons with different ones so it looks intentional. The leftover shirt or pants gets used for other things - cut up for rags mostly.
